meanings.definition: To position oneself or a military unit in such a way as to be protected from enemy fire.
meanings.sent1: Soldiers defilade behind the hill to avoid getting hit by enemy bullets.
meanings.sent2: The troops defilade behind the walls during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers decided to defilade behind the giant rock, playing a game of hide-and-seek with the enemy.
meanings.sent4: The trees defiladed the camp, shielding it from the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The fortress defiladed the city, keeping it safe from invaders.

meanings.definition: The protection or cover provided by such positioning.
meanings.sent1: The defilade of the bunker saved the soldiers from harm.
meanings.sent2: The defilade of the trench offered a safe haven during the bombardment.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella acted as a defilade from the rain, keeping me dry.
meanings.sent4: The thick bushes served as a defilade for the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The mountain acted as a natural defilade, shielding the village from strong winds.
